channel.title: G. Willow Wilson on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in G. Willow Wilson on jverkamp.com

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 10: Time and Again
item.description:
A weirdly weak ending. It felt like they were building up to so much more… but this is the end of this particular run. I suppose it’s time to find out where/what is next. Comics are confusing yo.

One Night Only

Sleepover!

Of course things go wrong. Over and over again.

And then‚Ä¶

Right.

It‚Äôs about time.

A cute story. Short though.

The Ratio

SCIENCE time with Bruno!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 9: Teenage Wasteland
item.description:
Teenage Wasteland

Ironic that.

A whole Ms. Marvel story about when it‚Äôs all too much and Kamala steps down.

It‚Äôs such a cute story. Some friends step up to (try) to take her place. Some (try to) track her down ‚Ä¶ for a sandwich. It‚Äôs what friendship is about.

Oh. And somehow the Inventor is back. But that‚Äôs not really the point now, is it?

I really liked this one.

Something New

Baby!

But that‚Äôs‚Ä¶ totally only the first few pages. After that, we get Bruno back (for a visit? Or more?), a new kid at school‚Ä¶ that can crush lockers with her bare hands, and oh so much relationship drama.

It‚Äôs a good time.

I wonder of Bruno shows up in any Black Panther issues while he was there.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 8: Mecca
item.description:
Mecca

K.I.N.D.‚Äîor anything but‚Äîis in town. Rounding up anyone that ‚Äòdoesn‚Äôt look like they belong‚Äô.

üòÉ No, not quite like that.

It‚Äôs a good one.

Northeast Corridor

And then‚Ä¶

People are good at ignoring things, but even that‚Äôs a bit obvious‚Ä¶

A cute enough story though.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 7: Damage Per Second
item.description:
Election Day

Politics! Get out and vote!

Man single issues are short.

Damage Per Second

Troll!

Or computer virus. Close enough.

Ready to reveal all the big bad secrets of the world.

Sometimes people are clueless. But sometimes Zoe is right on. She‚Äôs a fun side character.

It‚Äôs a cute story. Expected weird/sappy solution. So it goes.

Meanwhile in Wakanda

And as an aside, Bruno! In Wakanda!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 6: Civil War II
item.description:
High school athletic competition! New Jersey vs New York! Kamala vs‚Ä¶

Miles? Oh my.

Haven‚Äôt seen him for a while…

So that went well.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 5: Super Famous
item.description:
And‚Ä¶ swap. Continued volume numbering, new issue numbers. Same writer, new artists.

Onward!

Whoa, wait a minute. Less onward. More context!

Okay, so six months have passed. And it‚Äôs not just we the readers who missed everything‚Äîapparently Kamala‚Äôs been flaking hard as well.

lol.

Also, Tyesha!

Which makes everything even more super busy! So of course‚Ä¶

Yup. Bad idea.

So good.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 4: Last Days
item.description:
The world‚Ä¶ is ending.

Or at least that‚Äôs how it feels.

Didn‚Äôt she know him for like‚Ä¶ a couple days? I suppose it‚Äôs not that unusual. First times are so much bigger.

But still.

Bigger problems.

Also, the dream team up!

It‚Äôs fun and exactly the sort of thing Kamala dreamt about! Even if the scale of it all‚Ä¶ doesn‚Äôt really make sense. The end of the world looms and they‚Äôre starting with the looting?

But getting to the part of the story we saw in the show? ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù That‚Äôs the story I‚Äôm interested in!

A chaotic delightful mess of a story.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 3: Crushed
item.description:
‚Ä¶

Well. As far as hooks go, that is most certainly one of them.

Pity it‚Äôs only got one volume.

Other than that we get the introduction of Kamran‚Äîinstant meetcute with Kamala, what can possibly go wrong‚Äîinhuman strife, and‚Ä¶ a S.H.I.E.L.D. crossover?

Looks fun. Maybe I‚Äôll read that one next.

Anyways, everything feels like it‚Äôs flying by, in the way of comics. It takes too long to illustrate an entire volume, so everything gets crammed together.

Onward!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 2: Generation Why
item.description:
You know all those rumors about pet alligators flushed down the sewers?

Yeah, they generally fail to mention the freakin laser beams.

Comics are weird. Volume 2 and we‚Äôre already with the crossovers (hallucinatory Avengers don‚Äôt count). So many crossovers. But they‚Äôre cute! And it‚Äôs still mostly Ms. Marvel calling the shots.

A solid volume 2! Onward!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 1: No Normal
item.description:
Ms. Marvel! I watched the TV show, so this should be about the same right?

Right?

Well‚Ä¶ things get weird. Mostly due to an origin not entirely in the movies. So it‚Äôs a bit different.

But the feel?

It‚Äôs still street level, teen girl, dealing with being from a Pakistani family/Muslim born in America.

It‚Äôs a fun start!
